comment.author: 92006862@N05
comment._content: See Part 2 The Distinguished Service Order page 367 for more service details and confirmation of the award of DSO L.G.14.1.16. He was killed in action 8.7.16 in Caterpillar Wood on the east side of Mametz Village, at the First Battle of the Somme

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: CWGC website shows that he was the son of the late Major H. C. Wilkinson; husband of Gladys Mary Wilkinson (nee Rowlands). Served in the South African war. Medal Roll Index Card gives an address: 14 Chapel Park Road, St Leonard's on Sea. Major Henry Chandler Wilkinson was in residence at Plas Newydd Hall, Denbighshire in 1881 aged 46 and described as Retired from the Army. Sidney was then aged 3, born in Gillingham, Dorset. His baptism record of 9th September 1877 shows that he was born at Wyke Hall, Gillingham, Dorset and that his mother was Eleanor Lydia Grey (des Voex). The property still exists, although it has been sub-divided search.struttandparker.com/residential/wyke-hall-gillingh...
